wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the core purpose and functionality of the dify-markdown-chunker.qoder project. Explain its role as a specialized Python library for intelligent Markdown chunking optimized for RAG systems. Detail how it preserves structural integrity while enabling efficient retrieval through advanced content-aware strategies. Describe the integration with the Dify platform via plugin system, highlight key features such as automatic strategy selection, configurable overlap, and metadata enrichment. Provide a high-level explanation of the processing pipeline: parsing → analysis → strategy selection → chunking → post-processing. Include practical examples of use cases like AI knowledge base construction and technical documentation processing. Document the relationship between major components using the architecture diagram from architecture-audit-to-be/01-overview.md. Address both standalone library usage and Dify plugin deployment scenarios. Explain versioning strategy with legacy, current, and v2 implementations coexisting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Overlap Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the overlap management system in the Markdown chunker. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the OverlapManager class, including its role in maintaining context continuity between adjacent chunks. Document the different overlap handling modes (e.g., metadata preservation, content duplication prevention) and their configuration options. Describe how overlap size is calculated and enforced during chunking, and how overlapping content is merged without duplication. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how overlap is applied in structural and code-heavy documents. Explain the relationship between the OverlapManager and the ChunkingOrchestrator, and how overlap processing fits into the overall pipeline. Address common issues such as phantom content in overlaps and solutions implemented in the overlap_redesign_integration tests. Provide configuration examples demonstrating optimal overlap settings for different document types.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the core data models that form the foundation of the Markdown chunking system. Define and explain each key data structure: Chunk, ChunkingResult, ChunkConfig, and ContentAnalysis. For the Chunk model, detail its fields (content, start_line, end_line, metadata), invariants (start_line >= 1, end_line >= start_line, non-empty content), and properties (size, line_count, content_type). Explain how metadata enrichment adds contextual information like line numbers and content types. For ChunkingResult, describe its role in encapsulating the output of the chunking process, including the list of chunks, strategy used, processing time, and error/warning tracking. Detail ChunkConfig's configuration parameters that control chunking behavior such as max_chunk_size, min_chunk_size, overlap_size, and strategy thresholds. Explain ContentAnalysis as the output of the parsing phase, containing document metrics like code_ratio, complexity_score, and content_type that drive strategy selection. Use code examples from types.py to illustrate real implementations and show how these models interact throughout the chunking pipeline.

wiki_catalogs.name: Code Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Code Strategy, explaining its implementation in code_strategy.py. Detail how it preserves code blocks intact and groups related code with surrounding text. Explain the algorithmic approach using the CODE_RATIO_THRESHOLD and MIN_CODE_BLOCKS metrics for activation. Document the priority-based selection (highest priority) and its behavior when processing code-heavy documents. Include examples from the test suite showing input documents with high code ratios and the resulting chunk structure. Address common issues like handling nested code blocks and performance considerations for large code files. Provide configuration examples using ChunkConfig.for_code_docs() and force_strategy options.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dify Plugin Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for Dify plugin integration focused on the MarkdownChunkerProvider and MarkdownChunkTool classes. Explain how the provider implements the ToolProvider interface with its _validate_credentials method that acknowledges no external credentials are needed for local chunking operations. Document the MarkdownChunkTool's _invoke method that processes tool parameters (input_text, max_chunk_size, chunk_overlap, strategy, include_metadata) and generates Dify-compatible output. Detail how the tool formats chunk output with optional metadata filtering via _filter_metadata_for_rag, which removes statistical and internal fields while preserving RAG-useful information. Include examples from dify_integration.py showing Dify-compatible output formatting, RAG-optimized chunking configurations, and API endpoint simulation. Explain the manifest.yaml configuration that defines the tool's parameters and expected response format. Address error handling patterns and best practices for deploying the plugin within Dify workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the overall Markdown chunker system. Explain the modular design principles that enable extensibility and maintainability. Describe the high-level components: parser, strategy selector, chunking orchestrator, and post-processing modules. Illustrate the data flow from raw Markdown input through parsing, analysis, strategy selection, chunking, and output generation. Highlight key architectural decisions such as the use of AST-based parsing for structural accuracy and strategy pattern for adaptive chunking. Include system context diagrams showing integration points with Dify platform and standalone usage. Address cross-cutting concerns including error resilience, logging, and performance monitoring. Document the evolution path from legacy to v2 implementations as outlined in the architecture audit documents.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Analysis Algorithm
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the content analysis algorithm used in the Markdown chunker. Explain how the ContentAnalyzer class calculates key metrics such as code_ratio, list_ratio, table_ratio, and complexity_score. wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis of Dify Markdown Chunker

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The Dify Markdown Chunker is an advanced plugin designed to intelligently split Markdown documents into semantically meaningful chunks optimized for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems. Unlike basic text splitters, it preserves document structure, maintains code block integrity, and automatically selects the most appropriate chunking strategy based on content analysis.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Provide structural awareness in Markdown chunking to maintain context and hierarchy
- Automatically detect content types and select optimal chunking strategies
- Preserve semantic boundaries of code blocks, tables, lists, and headers
- Enable seamless integration with the Dify platform for knowledge base ingestion
- Support both plugin usage within Dify and standalone library usage

### Target Audience
- AI/ML engineers building RAG systems
- Technical writers managing documentation
- Developers working with code-heavy Markdown content
- Dify platform users requiring advanced document processing
- Data scientists processing structured technical documentation

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The project follows a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns between parsing, strategy selection, chunking, and post-processing components. The system is organized into legacy and modern implementations, with the legacy version (`markdown_chunker_legacy`) containing the mature, production-ready codebase.

### Design Patterns
The architecture employs several key design patterns:
- **Strategy Pattern**: Multiple chunking strategies that can be selected based on content analysis
- **Orchestrator Pattern**: Central coordination of the chunking pipeline
- **Dependency Injection**: Components are injected into the main chunker class
- **Factory Pattern**: Configuration profiles create pre-configured instances
- **Fallback Pattern**: Graceful degradation through multiple fallback levels

### System Relationships
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Application] --> B[Dify Plugin Entry Point]
    B --> C[MarkdownChunker]
    C --> D[ParserInterface]
    C --> E[StrategySelector]
    C --> F[FallbackManager]
    C --> G[OverlapManager]
    C --> H[MetadataEnricher]
    D --> I[AST Builder]
    E --> J[CodeStrategy]
    E --> K[MixedStrategy]
    E --> L[ListStrategy]
    E --> M[TableStrategy]
    E --> N[StructuralStrategy]
    E --> O[SentencesStrategy]
    C --> P[ChunkingOrchestrator]
    P --> Q[DataCompletenessValidator]
    C --> R[OutputTransformer]
```

### Data Flow
```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Raw Markdown] --> B[Parser]
    B --> C[AST & Analysis]
    C --> D[Strategy Selection]
    D --> E[Chunking Strategy]
    E --> F[Raw Chunks]
    F --> G[Overlap Processing]
    G --> H[Metadata Enrichment]
    H --> I[Validation]
    I --> J[Final Chunks]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `main.py` - Dify plugin entry point that initializes and runs the plugin
- `markdown_chunker_legacy/chunker/core.py` - Primary chunking interface
- `manifest.yaml` - Dify plugin configuration and metadata

### Core Modules
- `markdown_chunker_legacy/parser/` - AST-based parsing and content analysis
- `markdown_chunker_legacy/chunker/` - Chunking strategies and orchestration
- `markdown_chunker_legacy/chunker/strategies/` - Six specialized chunking strategies
- `provider/` - Dify plugin provider implementation

### Configuration Approach
- `requirements.txt` - Project dependencies
- `manifest.yaml` - Dify plugin configuration
- `ChunkConfig` class - Programmatic configuration with factory methods
- Configuration profiles for different use cases (code-heavy, Dify RAG, search indexing)

### External Dependencies
- `dify_plugin` - Integration with Dify platform
- `markdown-it-py` - Markdown parsing
- `pydantic` - Data validation and settings management
- `PyYAML` - Configuration file parsing
- `pytest` and `hypothesis` - Testing framework

### Integration Points
- `provider/markdown_chunker.py` - Dify plugin provider
- `tools/markdown_chunk_tool.py` - Dify tool implementation
- API adapters for external system integration

### Component Relationships
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[MarkdownChunker] --> B[ParserInterface]
    A --> C[StrategySelector]
    A --> D[FallbackManager]
    A --> E[OverlapManager]
    A --> F[MetadataEnricher]
    A --> G[ChunkingOrchestrator]
    A --> H[OutputTransformer]
    C --> I[CodeStrategy]
    C --> J[MixedStrategy]
    C --> K[ListStrategy]
    C --> L[TableStrategy]
    C --> M[StructuralStrategy]
    C --> N[SentencesStrategy]
    G --> O[DataCompletenessValidator]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The Dify Markdown Chunker provides intelligent, context-aware Markdown segmentation with automatic strategy selection based on content analysis. It preserves document structure while creating optimally sized chunks for downstream processing in RAG systems.

### Implementation Highlights
- Adaptive strategy selection based on content analysis
- Six specialized chunking strategies for different content types
- Configurable overlap with multiple handling modes
- Comprehensive metadata including line numbers and content types
- Fallback mechanisms for error resilience
- Performance monitoring capabilities

### Feature Architecture
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> ContentAnalysis: chunk()
    ContentAnalysis --> StrategySelection: AST & metrics
    StrategySelection --> CodeStrategy: code_ratio ≥ 30%
    StrategySelection --> MixedStrategy: code_ratio ≥ 30% & complexity ≥ 0.3
    StrategySelection --> ListStrategy: ≥5 lists OR list_ratio > 60%
    StrategySelection --> TableStrategy: ≥3 tables OR table_ratio > 40%
    StrategySelection --> StructuralStrategy: ≥3 headers, depth > 1
    StrategySelection --> SentencesStrategy: Default/fallback
    CodeStrategy --> Chunking: Apply strategy
    MixedStrategy --> Chunking: Apply strategy
    ListStrategy --> Chunking: Apply strategy
    TableStrategy --> Chunking: Apply strategy
    StructuralStrategy --> Chunking: Apply strategy
    SentencesStrategy --> Chunking: Apply strategy
    Chunking --> PostProcessing: Raw chunks
    PostProcessing --> Overlap: Apply overlap
    PostProcessing --> Metadata: Enrich metadata
    PostProcessing --> Validation: Validate completeness
    PostProcessing --> FinalOutput: Processed chunks
    FinalOutput --> Idle: Return result
```

Sources:
- [main.py](/home/dalamar81/git/dify-markdown-chunker.qoder/main.py)
- [manifest.yaml](/home/dalamar81/git/dify-markdown-chunker.qoder/manifest.yaml)
- [requirements.txt](/home/dalamar81/git/dify-markdown-chunker.qoder/requirements.txt)
- [README.md](/home/dalamar81/git/dify-markdown-chunker.qoder/README.md)
- [markdown_chunker_legacy/chunker/core.py](/home/dalamar81/git/dify-markdown-chunker.qoder/markdown_chunker_legacy/chunker/core.py)
- [markdown_chunker_legacy/parser/core.py](/home/dalamar81/git/dify-markdown-chunker.qoder/markdown_chunker_legacy/parser/core.py)
</blog>
